utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The entrance to the dungeon is a moss covered door. You manage to open it only to find yourself face-to-face with a hideous, foul-smelling, moss-covered ogre. What do you do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I say, hey Ma, what’s for dinner?”

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Seventeen. The ogre is amused by your joke and allows you to pass. By the by, I liked it, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, how go the wedding plans, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great. We spent five hours last night at Macy’s registering for gifts. Looks like I’m finally going to have that darling little earthenware asparagus dish I’ve always wanted.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See, this is the good thing about having a girlfriend 9,000 miles away. I can spend my nights doing whatever I want.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You mean like playing nerd games with us and then taking a suspiciously long shower?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe. We enter the dungeon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You see a dragon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? So we’re playing Dungeons and Dragons, and we walk into a dungeon and see a dragon? Isn’t that a little on the nose?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When you play Chutes and Ladders, do you complain about all the chutes and all the ladders?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you gonna eat that whole pie?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe. Why not? Who do I have in my life to watch my figure for?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, God, did you watch Bridget Jones again?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s just that everybody’s got someone. Sheldon’s with Amy, Howard’s getting married, you’re dating my sister.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now that Howard’s getting married, maybe he’ll inflate one of his old girlfriends for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know who I blame for my loneliness? The United States of America. Your movies and your TV shows promised streets paved with beautiful blonde women with big bazongas.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Eat another pie, you’ll have your own bazongas.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s cruel. You know it goes straight to my hips.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, please focus. You’re facing a fire-breathing dragon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know if I want to play anymore.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because you don’t have a girlfriend? Well, good Lord, if that becomes a reason not to play Dungeons and Dragons, this game’s in serious trouble.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now, I assume we use this same wax later on to neaten up each other’s bikini regions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, my bikini region is fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who’s shocked? I’m not. So, Bernadette, how’s the wedding planning going? And I’m not asking as a prospective bridesmaid. Pick me! Pick me!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We went cake-tasting yesterday. Raj came along. He cried and ate half the samples.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, the poor guy’s so lonely. We should set him up with someone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, I met a really cute girl at work. She’s married to a guy in one of our drug trials.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, hello? She’s married.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, but her husband is in serious congestive heart failure, and a little birdie told me he’s in the placebo group.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so future grief-stricken widow is the one to beat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are we ready to order?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One moment. I’m conducting an experiment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: With Dungeons and Dragons dice?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. From here on in, I’ve decided to make all trivial decisions with a throw of the dice, thus freeing up my mind to do what it does best, enlighten and amaze. Page 14, item seven.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, what’s for dinner?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A side of corn succotash. Hmm. Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, Howard, can I see you for a minute, please?

utterance.speaker: Howard

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, no, that’s not it. Just come with me, please.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s see what I’ll be washing that succotash down with. A pitcher of margaritas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you really want that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s the great thing. It doesn’t matter. My mind is freed up to think about more important things.

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hamburgers and lemonade.

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj says it’s nice to meet you, too. She says she has to go back to her family, but Penny has her number if you want to text her and get together.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to play it cool. Tell her, maybe. Whatever, babe.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’ll text you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ah, look at that. I have a date. I love America again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, as soon as she gets here, so she knows I’m cool with it, I’m going to make a joke about her being deaf. I was thinking, hey, did you hear the one about…? Oh, no, I bet you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe we should revisit your lonely fat guy plan.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, she’s here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No joke. Oh, she says she’s sorry she’s late.

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.content: Really? That’s the first thing you want to say?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I worked on it all night. Use it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, I don’t know the sign for opalescent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then spell it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know how to spell it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re blowing this for me!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He likes your eyes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re making me sound like a caveman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She says, thank you, you have nice eyes, too.”

utterance.speaker: Raj

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You really want to ask her that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right. Everyone loves music.

utterance.speaker: Howard

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, but when I was six years old, I tried to start a boy band called Frankie Goes to Bollywood. But I couldn’t get any other boys to join, so my parents asked the servants to be my backup dancers. Wait, when you sign servants, don’t sign it like I’m bragging. Sign it in a way that I sound humble with just a hint of, that’s right, I had servants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you hear yourself

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, but she doesn’t. So get signing, hand monkey.

utterance.speaker: Howard (translating for Emily)
utterance.content: I think I wrote a letter to Santa Claus every day. And then on Christmas morning, under the tree is a little puppy with a red ribbon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Texting Bernadette that I’m gonna be late.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, what is she saying?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s a funny story about a puppy. Just smile and laugh. Quick, quick, stop smiling.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The puppy died, it choked on a doll head. Sad face, sad face!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a little hard to see with the city lights, but that W-shaped constellation is Cassiopeia. And she was the mother of Andromeda who’s over there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, pretty stars. This is her car. She hopes she can see you again sometime.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good, good. Oh, boy, help me out here. Does she want me to kiss her or not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I speak sign language, I don’t read minds.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you were me, would you kiss her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’m a make out king.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was so smooth on that date.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You? I made you smooth. You were an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Whatever, dude. She kissed me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It might’ve been on your lips, but it was my kiss.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, fine. Let’s agree she kissed both of us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mustache is looking good there, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t thank me. Thank the dice. They told me what percentage of my face to shave.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why are you still doing this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because it’s working. In the past few weeks, unburdened by trivial decisions, I’ve co-authored two papers in notable peer-reviewed journals, and I’m close to figuring out why the Large Hadron Collider has yet to isolate the Higgs boson particle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You left out, got chafed testicles because you no longer wear underpants.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The dice giveth and the dice taketh away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is Raj out with Emily again?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, every night for the last month.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, can’t believe he has a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (rolls dice)
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here’s some other fun news on the Raj/Emily front. He gave her a pair of diamond earrings and leased her a car.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You think she’s taking advantage of him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, of course not. She wouldn’t do something like that. She’s deaf.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Deaf women can’t be gold diggers?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Handicapped people are nice, Leonard. Everyone knows that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I actually have information about Raj that would be helpful with this discussion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Could you tell us?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s see. Snake eyes. Sorry, bud.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, hang on. Doubles. Roll again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, get this. It doesn’t matter if he’s showering her with gifts, because the Koothrappalis are vastly wealthy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you mean, vastly wealthy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, wealthy means a lot of money, and vastly means even more. I’m not sure what’s tripping you up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I know they have money. I don’t think it’s that much.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, you’re wrong. See, as you know, a few years ago, I achieved one of my lesser dreams and became a notary public. Well, from time to time, I notarize banking documents for Raj. The Koothrappalis aren’t just rich, they’re Richie Rich rich.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, so how much is that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: About halfway between Bruce Wayne and Scrooge McDuck.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell? The last time we went to the zoo, that son of a bitch made me buy him a churro.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, guys, I’m sorry, I don’t mean to be rude, but I need to go call Raj’s sister, who I love so much. So vastly much.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so he’s got money, and it’s a few gifts and a car.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And she got him to pay off all her credit cards.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? He paid off her credit cards? Damn it, I could’ve dated Raj for a couple months. But I, I wouldn’t have, because I’m not that kind of girl. We should really talk to Raj.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s not going to listen, he’s in love.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can’t figure out what to do? I remember those days. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have to… stay right here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, this is a bad idea. We should go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I’m the one that introduced him to her. I’ve got to say something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re engaged to my friend.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Bernadette doesn’t mind where I get my motor running, as long as I park in the right garage.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re engaged to my friend. Oh, here she comes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Smart. Whisper so the deaf chick can’t hear you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Howard (translating)
utterance.content: Oh, hey, hi. Nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, can we talk to you about Raj?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She says, sure, what about him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, um, gosh, how do I start? Um, see, Raj is kind of naive. I mean, he hasn’t dated a whole lot of women. And I’m concerned that, without meaning to, you might be taking advantage of him. You know, by letting him buy you a bunch of expensive things.And I.. I… Howard, focus. Tell her what I’m saying.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right. Are you a gold digger or not? Oh, uh, something, something, who the something do you think you are? Mind your own something business and go something yourself. Oh, wait, I got this now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m so mad at you!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, wait…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How dare you ambush my girlfriend at the gym!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We didn’t mean for it to be an ambush. Just, it’s kind of impossible not to sneak up on deaf people. And hey, since when are you so chatty?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m hammered.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Raj, come here. This girl is trouble. I mean, what kind of relationship is it where you buy her gifts and she gives you sex?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The best one I ever had!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, come on. You know you can do better.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aha. I see what’s going on here. You and I had our crazy night together, and now you can’t stand to see me with another woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s okay. I can’t get mad at your feelings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t have feelings.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s good. Keep telling yourself that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He is cuter now that I know he’s rich.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I have a surprise for you. Cover your eyes. Open them. It’s a real ruby. It was a little expensive, but no one can put a price on love. Although, the people at Cartier took a pretty good shot at it. Oh, Mummy, Daddy. What a nice surprise.

utterance.content: No, it’s not a nice surprise, it’s a bad surprise.

utterance.content: Penny called us.

utterance.content: Penny?

utterance.content: She told us you’re spending all our money on your new girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I just got her a couple of things. She gives me things, too.

utterance.content: You need to find a nice Indian girl from a good family. If you keep seeing this woman, you’re cut off.

utterance.content: Hah. You’re an idiot. Love doesn’t last. Well, he’s going to find out eventually. Think about it.
